Summer Fashion Inspired by The Summer I Turned Pretty

Come for the new season fashion finds, stay for the summer love story.
Published 15 September

With the highly anticipated finale of The Summer I Turned Pretty upon us, we’re counting down not only to the big reveal but also to one last look at the cast’s effortlessly cool summer style. Breezy dresses. Relaxed denim. Preppy polos. Polished party looks. It’s the kind of wardrobe that makes every summer moment feel like magic.

The best part is you don’t have to live in Cousins Beach to channel the cast’s signature style. Everything you need is waiting for you at Watergardens. Here’s how to recreate the looks of your favourites:

Belly’s style: Youthful and feminine

Belly’s style is all about youthful femininity with a touch of nostalgia. She loves soft sundresses, pastel knits, and denim shorts, perfect for picnics, beach days, and summer nights. This season, Belly channelled a bunch of fun looks—including a super sweet ‘something blue’ for her bridal shower.

 

Shop Belly’s look: Pick up sweet summer dresses at Forever New, cute shoulder bags from Cotton On, and feminine jewellery pieces from Lovisa. Finish it with sandals from Novo for a simple, sweet look.

 

Pictured: Forever New Dress | Lovisa necklace | Kmart headband | Cotton On bag

 

 

Conrad’s style: Laid-back classic

 

Conrad has mastered the timeless coastal look. Think clean polos, crisp button-downs, and well-worn denim paired with easy sneakers. Of course, it wouldn’t be a Conrad outfit without a sleek classic watch. His understated wardrobe lets his brooding charm do the talking.

 

Shop Conrad’s look: Stock up on high-quality essentials from Indsutrie, everyday tees at Tarocash, or lightweight linen shirts from Ghanda. Add a pair of fresh JD Sports sneakers to keep things casual yet refined.

 

Pictured: Ghanda Shirt | Converse sneakers, JD Sports | Angus & Coote watch

 

Jeremiah’s style: Preppy and playful

 

Jeremiah brings a playful, preppy charm to every scene, and his wardrobe reflects that. From printed shirts to bold shorts and accessories, he’s the guy who never takes himself too seriously. Channel his style with collared short-sleeve polos, relaxed rugby tops and fun sneakers.

 

Shop Jeremiah’s look: Find crisp cotton polos at Connor, patterned swim shorts at Rebel, or Jeremiah’s casual sneakers from JD Sports.

 

 

Pictured: JD Sports Sneakers | Kmart Rugby Shirt | OPSM Rayban Glasses

 

Taylor’s style: Trendy and fashion-forward

 

Belly’s bestie Taylor loves to stand out, whether in a cute matching set, bodycon mini, or bold accessories. Her style is trend-led and unapologetically confident. Take inspiration from Taylor and make a statement with fun prints, bold colours and figure-fitting pieces.

 

Shop Taylor’s look: Score a cute Taylor-style top from Cotton On, colourful heels at Novo, and sparkly accessories at Pandora.

 

Pictured: Cotton On Top | Supre Shorts | Pandora necklace

 

Laurel’s style: Chic and elegant

 

Belly’s mum, Laurel, balances comfort and elegance with her polished yet relaxed summer style. She’s a fan of wide-leg linen pants, simple silk blouses, and neutral tones perfect for warm days. To replicate Laurel’s look, stick to a neutral colour palette and high-quality fabrics.

Shop Laurel’s look: Browse Decjuba for elevated basics, Seed Heritage for breezy linen, and Harli and Harpa for elegant finishing touches. 

Pictured: Decjuba top | Harli and Harpa earrings | Seed Heritage bag

 

Steven’s style: Smart casual

 

Belly’s brother, Steven, leans into smart-casual looks that strike the balance between preppy, fun and relaxed. Classic chinos, statement shirts, and sneakers that work for both family dinners and late-night bonfires are his wardrobe staples.

 

Shop Steven’s look: Find versatile chinos at Universal Store, relaxed button-up shirts at YD, and timeless sneakers from Rebel. Add a sleek watch from Michael Hill for that finishing touch that says “effortlessly put together.”

 

Pictured: YD Slides | YD shirt
